meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm thrilled to dive into the world of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2, a remastered delight that has critics (and gamers) raving. Before we get started, let me just say that I've had my fair share of embarrassing gaming moments. Like the time I tried to ollie off a ramp and ended up wiping out in slow motion. Yeah, it was... quite the experience.

Now, back to the game! It's clear that this remake has struck a chord with many critics, including IGN, who praised its "tremendous turnaround" from the disappointing Pro Skater 5. GameSpot echoed similar sentiments, saying that despite some downsides, the game's satisfying combos and engaging challenge system make it a success.

Game Informer took things to the next level, declaring the game a "terrific blast from the past" that feels fresh and current with its contemporary visuals and smooth gameplay. Meanwhile, Gaming Age gave the game a perfect score (100%), hailing it as one of the best remasters available.

Other critics like Worth Playing and SpazioGames were equally impressed, highlighting the game's many features and nostalgic value. Even Cheat Code Central, which is notorious for being tough on games, couldn't help but praise Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1+2, calling it a "perfect remaster" that exceeds expectations.

While opinions may vary (I mean, what's not to love about skateboarding?), one thing is clear: this game has captured the hearts of many. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the original or just looking for a fun, pick-up-and-play experience, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a must-try.

So, what are you waiting for? Grab your board and get ready to shred (or, you know, just enjoy the ride) in this fantastic remastered game!
